decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays like Voldaren Thrillseeker and Voldaren Epicure, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and disruption like Thoughtseize. It also includes a unique win condition in Tree of Perdition to quickly drain opponent's life total. The deck's strategy revolves around fast-paced plays and applying constant pressure on the opponent to win the game before they can stabilize. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to generate card advantage with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value. The deck also includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Castle Ardenvale to further control the board state. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing removal spells, hand disruption, and land destruction to control the game while generating advantage through cards like Waste Not and Geier Reach Sanitarium. It also includes powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Liliana of the Veil to close out the game. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, strip away their resources, and outvalue them with efficient threats and card advantage. The deck aims to grind out victories by controlling the board and overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells and creatures.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful instant spells. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with spells like Titan's Strength and Reckless Rage to deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck, allowing for access to an additional powerful card. By applying relentless pressure and using efficient removal spells, this deck aims to quickly take control of the game and defeat opponents before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of aggressive creatures in order to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage quickly. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of mana ramp creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic allows for quick deployment of larger threats like Archon of Emeria and Lovestruck Beast. The deck also has access to cards like Emeria's Call and Turntimber Symbiosis for additional late-game value and resilience.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It aims to cast cheap spells like Opt, Consider, and Fiery Impulse to trigger the Phoenix's ability and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of Treasure Cruise and Ledger Shredder helps maintain card advantage and smooth out draws. With a mix of disruption, removal, and card draw, the deck looks to end the game quickly while controlling the board and graveyard interactions.

Control your opponent's resources and hand while generating value with cards like Waste Not and Liliana of the Veil. Use removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to keep the board clear, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Go Blank. Build towards a late-game advantage with card advantage engines like Castle Locthwain and Geier Reach Sanitarium, and finish with powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet. The win condition is to outlast and outvalue your opponent through resource management and efficient removal.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures, burn spells, and pump effects to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring to provide additional consistency and versatility. The deck aims to swarm the board with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Callous Sell-Sword, then finish off the opponent with burn spells like Ancestral Anger and Slickshot Show-Off. The inclusion of mana-fixing lands like Den of the Bugbear and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance helps ensure the deck can consistently cast its spells and apply pressure to the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The goal is to apply pressure early on with cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Graveyard Trespasser, while using cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful finishers like Archfiend of the Dross and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to seal the deal. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation and Fires of Invention to control the board and generate value through powerful creatures and enchantments. By utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck aims to maximize its resources and overwhelm opponents with a wide range of threats. With a toolbox of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Leyline Binding, the deck can adapt to different matchups and disrupt opponents' strategies. The key concept is to establish control of the battlefield while consistently generating value and closing out games with powerful finishers like Elesh Norn and Atraxa.
